name: Education Access
lede: Scholarships, safe classrooms, and mentoring programs keep rural students on track to graduate and dream bigger.
summary: Scholarships, safe classrooms, and mentorship for rural students to stay in school.
impact: 92% of SWAN scholars graduated secondary school last year.
body: Scholarships cover tuition, uniforms, and entrance exam prep.
School rehab teams retrofit classrooms and libraries after disasters.
Mentorship clubs pair older students with primary school learners.

faq.q: How are students selected for scholarships?
faq.a: Local teachers nominate students based on financial need, attendance, and community leadership. A SWAN committee verifies each case before awards are made.
Yes. Every scholarship fund sets aside 8% to train teachers in trauma-informed instruction and digital literacy.

name: Community Health
lede: Mobile health camps run by Nepali nurses deliver checkups, medicines, and wellness training in hard-to-reach villages.
summary: Mobile health camps and women’s wellness programs with trusted local nurses.
impact: 9,500+ medical consultations provided in remote districts.
body: Mobile clinics offer maternal, pediatric, and chronic care checkups.
Emergency funds cover referrals to partner hospitals when needed.
Health promoters train local volunteers in nutrition and hygiene.

faq.q: Which districts do the mobile camps visit?
faq.a: Camps rotate through Dhading, Lamjung, and Kaski districts, prioritising wards without permanent health posts.

faq.q: What support is provided after clinic days?
faq.a: Patients needing follow-up get transport stipends and referrals to partner hospitals. Nurses track outcomes through a shared case system.

name: Women’s Leadership
lede: Micro-grants and coaching empower women-led cooperatives to launch enterprises and keep profits in their communities.
summary: Micro-grants and trainings for women-led cooperatives focused on livelihoods.
body: Seed funding for cooperatives investing in agriculture and services.
Financial literacy and digital record-keeping workshops.
Market linkages to help cooperatives sell beyond their village.

faq.q: Do grants need to be repaid?
faq.a: Most investments are structured as low-interest revolving loans so repayments seed the next cooperative.
